intro: Xanthoxalis dillenii var. piletorum, commonly known as the hairy goldencup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and yellow-orange flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Xanthoxalis dillenii var. piletorum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
